description.p: Small, persistent little creatures. Slugcats dominate the ecosystem, their unique abilities and traits allowing them to run circles around larger predators and hunt smaller prey. These critters come in many forms; agressive hunters to aquatic life forms. They made their way through the world fashioning weapons out of anything they could get their paws on.
Ability Score Increase. Your Dexterity score increases by 2, your Constitution decreases by 2
Age.Slugcats age rather quickly, often reaching adulthood in just 5 years or so.
Alignment. Slugcats don't tend to have any particular alignment but may be considered chaotic.
Size. Small
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You can climb and swim 15ft
Languages. You can write Common and use your paws to gesture at creatures
Subrace. Pick a subrace that best describes the nature of your Slugcat.
All slugcats have a keen sense for scavenging. Small objects can be fashioned into spears and food can be fashioned into rations.

Slugcat's have proficiency in Investigation and Survival Checks, due to their time spent living off of scraps. Rations will provide one food pip dependent on the slugcat, and spears can be held if there is a hand free. In combat, the scavenge action can be taken to find a spear.

One Consequence of a Slugcat's animal behaviour is that they are not well trained with weaponry. They can learn to use a weapon, but won't be proficient in anything but spear/grenade throwing. Any weapon with the Heavy property will force the slugcat to roll with disadvantage to hit, and two handed weapons prevent the scavenging and use of spears in combat. Most slugcats can store one spear each, with exceptions.

The Spear is arguably the most important part of a slugcat's arsenal. It has a range of 35ft, can be extended with any ranged weapon extensions, and deals a base damage of 1d10 piercing damage. This damage increases by 1d10 at level 3,5,8,13,15 and by 2d10 at level 18.
Food pips have two uses; combat and karma.
When the slugcat longrests with a full set of food pips, their karma level will increase by 1, to a maximum of 5. If they long rest without full food pip, the karma decreases by 1.
The slugcat experiences no effects.
The Slugcat becomes proficient in Performance
The Slugcat becomes proficient in Animal Handling
The Slugcat becomes proficient in Sleight of Hand
The Slugcat becomes an expert in Survival
Food pips are the core of a slugcats survival. With food pips, the slugcat is capable of improving their combat effectiveness.
Every slugcat has a max of 5 pips to use, and pips are filled with rations typically or other foodstuffs to the GM's consideration.
Each slugcat has actions they can take with the food pips;
Use your bonus action to consume 1 food pip to restore 1d4 HP, is increased to 2d4 at level 7 and 4d4 at level 13.
Use your bonus action to consume 1 food pip and until the end of your turn have +2 to hit and damage.
Use your action to consume 2 food pips and, until the end of your turn, double your movement speed.
Pick a subrace that best describes the nature of your Slugcat.
The Survivor is a balanced creature. Agressive enough to consume small bugs and scare away beasts, and quick enough to rest easy
The Survivor's Adaptability All your stats increase by 1.
No Dietary Requirements The Survivor can eat bugs and berries for a food pip each.
The hunter is a strong warrior subrace of the slugcats, with a greater movement speed and much more flexability with their weaponry
Ability Score Increase Your Strength score is increased by 3
Movement Speed Increase Your Movement speed is increased by 10ft
Play it Safe The Hunter can prepare an additional spear before or during combat.
Carnivore The Hunter can eat bodies larger than them and gain additional food pips equivalent to how much larger the target is. However, all other sources of food only provide quater pips

(Optional) Time Limit At each long rest, roll a d12. If the roll is 3 or lower, roll for a symptom suffered by your hunter on the symptoms table and make note of how many times you have rolled below a 3 in your campaign. If you have suffered 20 times, your hunter will die and become a Hunter Long Legs.
The Rivulet is a curious specimen, having evolved to live in bodies of water with its striking gills and nimble body
Ability Score Increase Your Charisma score is increased by 3
Aquatic Lifeform The Rivulet can move through bodies of water without losing movement speed and can breathe underwater.
No Dietary Requirements The Rivulet can eat bugs and berries for a food pip each.
The Gourmand is an impressive mass of slugcat. Devouring anything that can fit into its mouth, this slugcat doesn't just survive; it thrives.
Ability Score Increase Your Constitution score is increased by 4
Too Hungry The Gourmand loses 10ft of movement speed.
No Dietary Requirements: 2 The Gourmand can eat anything that fits in its mouth, and can eat two foodstuffs at a time which will start a roll on the gourmand d12 table of flavour.
Fatty Throw The Gourmand can throw the spear with such force that it consumes 4 food pips and deals an extra 4d10 piercing damage
The Artificer is a slugcat often saddled with a tragic tale. It weilds explosive power so volatile that it can tear itself apart
Ability Score Increase Your Intelligence score is increased by 3.
Explosive Attitude The Artificer gains 10ft of movement speed.
Carnivore The Artificer can eat bodies larger than them and gain additional food pips equivalent to how much larger the target is. However, all other sources of food only provide quater pips

Arms Dealer The Artificer can use 3 food pips to make a grenade. This grenade has a range of 40ft, is a thrown item, can be thrown over obstacles and deals 2d12 fire damage in a 10ft radius. 3/short rest. Damage increases by 2d12 at level 5,13,18 and 4d12 at 20.

Volatile Flight The Artificer can use their action to explode and fly 50ft dealing no damage to themselves and not provoking opportunity attack, but cannot use their action next turn or a reaction until the end of their next turn.
Violent Nature The Artificer cannot gain Karma
The Spearmaster is a mutation of the slugcats core interactions with the world. From its body erupts organic spears that suck the vitality from creatures to sustain the Spearmaster.
Ability Score Increase Your Dexterity and Strength score is increased by 2

Unfortunate Development The Spearmaster has no mouth so cannot cast vocal spells, and cannot eat without using its spears. The Spearmaster generates its spears with an action, and can use a bonus action to produce 2 in one turn. If Spearmaster is holding two spears, once one is thrown with an action a second can be thrown with a bonus action.
Parasitic Relationship The Spearmaster gains food pips by throwing its organic spears at living enemies. Each successful hit is 1 pip, and criticals are double.
The Saint is a rare slugcat, often with strange markings upon its forehead and a distinctive, long tongue it uses for travel.
Ability Score Increase Your Wisdom score is increased by 3
Is there a Vegan Menu? The Saint cannot eat any meat, and can only gain food pips with rations purchased or made from berries.
Grapple Tongue The Saint gains 25ft of climbing speed and can use its tongue to grab objects up to 25ft away that it can see. It can also hang from ceilings or rails with its tongue.
Pacifist The Saint cannot use spears, but will gain 2 cleric cantrips to assist in combat.

Ascension At level 15, The Saint achieves a new level of spirituality. 1/long rest, the Saint can choose 1 creature within 100ft to be 'ascended'. The target must roll a Wisdom saving throw with DC equivalent to your spellcasting DC. If the target fails and has less than 120HP, it will lose its sentience and die immediately. If it fails and has more than 120HP, it will take 12d12 Radiant Damage. On a success, the target will take 6d12 radiant damage.
"It does not matter whenever the door is opened, closed or passed through. The lock is the key and the key is the means."
Ability Score Increase Your Constitution score is decreased by -10, your Charisma is increased by 10.
